responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure Temporary File Creation
    analysis: |
      The TempFileUtil class creates temporary files with insecure permissions, allowing any local user to potentially read or modify the contents of these files. This vulnerability could be exploited by an unauthorized user to access or manipulate potentially sensitive data processed or stored by the application. The method writeInputStreamToFile in the TempFileUtil.java file writes content to a temporary file using a predictable filename pattern with default permissions, which does not restrict access to the file on shared systems.
    cwe: CWE-377
    function_names:
      - writeInputStreamToFile
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/monitorjbl/xlsx/impl/TempFileUtil.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Improper XML External Entity Prevention
    analysis: |
      The XMLUtils class parses XML input and does not disable XML External Entity (XXE) processing. This could allow an attacker to perform XXE attacks, potentially leading to unauthorized access to sensitive file data or denial of service when processing XML input. Specifically, the method document(InputStream is) uses a default configuration for the DocumentBuilderFactory, which could be misused to access local resources or cause remote resource fetching.
    cwe: CWE-611
    function_names:
      - document
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/monitorjbl/xlsx/XmlUtils.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Invalid Data Stream Closing
    analysis: |
      The getSharedStringsTable method in the BufferedStringsTable class might potentially fail to properly close InputStream instances on exceptions, leading to resource leaks which could exhaust system resources affecting application performance. The method opens an InputStream to read data but does not ensure closure of this stream in all paths of execution, specifically when exceptions occur before the method exits.
    cwe: CWE-404
    function_names:
      - getSharedStringsTable
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/com/monitorjbl/xlsx/sst/BufferedStringsTable.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure Temporary File Creation
leads.analysis: The TempFileUtil class creates temporary files with insecure permissions, allowing any local user to potentially read or modify the contents of these files. This vulnerability could be exploited by an unauthorized user to access or manipulate potentially sensitive data processed or stored by the application. The method writeInputStreamToFile in the TempFileUtil.java file writes content to a temporary file using a predictable filename pattern with default permissions, which does not restrict access to the file on shared systems.

leads.headline: Improper XML External Entity Prevention
leads.analysis: The XMLUtils class parses XML input and does not disable XML External Entity (XXE) processing. This could allow an attacker to perform XXE attacks, potentially leading to unauthorized access to sensitive file data or denial of service when processing XML input. Specifically, the method document(InputStream is) uses a default configuration for the DocumentBuilderFactory, which could be misused to access local resources or cause remote resource fetching.

leads.headline: Invalid Data Stream Closing
leads.analysis: The getSharedStringsTable method in the BufferedStringsTable class might potentially fail to properly close InputStream instances on exceptions, leading to resource leaks which could exhaust system resources affecting application performance. The method opens an InputStream to read data but does not ensure closure of this stream in all paths of execution, specifically when exceptions occur before the method exits.
